page.title: 04LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: If you are in Dunfermline you will frequently hear the name "Carnegie" _ the man who gave away Â£350 000 000. It is Andrew Carnegie, born in Moodie Street in 1835. He went to America in his childhood and became the "King of Steel" and the richest man in the world. When he came back he bought Pittencrieff Glen to be used for the benefit of the citizens of Dunfermline. He provided the money to build the Public Library, Swimming Baths and Carnegie Hall. He also set up the Carnegie Trust which administers the Carnegie money, providing finance for many Dunfermline projects. Local schools benefit from the trust with annual prizes and grants. His name is remembered in clubs like Carnegie Hockey Club, Swimming Club
